description: MindForge Niche Templates — Pre-built intelligence for common business types

local_service.label: Local Service Business
local_service.description: Businesses providing services in a specific geographic area (plumbers, electricians, repair shops, cleaning services, etc.)

suggested_pages.name: Home
suggested_pages.purpose: Hero with main CTA (call/book), trust signals, service highlights

suggested_pages.name: Services
suggested_pages.purpose: Detailed list of all services with descriptions and pricing

suggested_pages.name: Areas We Serve
suggested_pages.purpose: Geographic coverage map/list for local SEO

suggested_pages.name: Contact
suggested_pages.purpose: Phone, email, form, map, working hours

suggested_pages.name: FAQ
suggested_pages.purpose: Common questions to reduce support calls

suggested_pages.name: Emergency Service
suggested_pages.purpose: 24/7 availability page with prominent phone number

key_questions: What specific services do you offer? List them all, even small ones.
What geographic area do you cover? Specific cities, districts, or radius?
Do you offer emergency/urgent service? If so, what are the hours?
How do customers currently contact you? Phone, WhatsApp, email?
Do you want customers to book appointments online, or just call?
Do you have photos of completed work (before/after)?
Do you have existing Google reviews or testimonials?

design_hints.colors: blues, greens (trust), with warm accents (orange/amber for CTAs)
design_hints.key_element: Phone number and CTA must be visible without scrolling
design_hints.imagery: real photos of team/work preferred over stock

admin_needs: View and respond to contact form submissions
Manage working hours and service areas

ecommerce.label: E-Commerce / Online Store
ecommerce.description: Businesses selling physical or digital products online

suggested_pages.name: Catalog/Shop
suggested_pages.purpose: All products with filters, sorting, search

suggested_pages.name: Product Page
suggested_pages.purpose: Photos, description, price, reviews, add to cart

suggested_pages.name: Cart
suggested_pages.purpose: Review items, quantities, total, proceed to checkout

key_questions: How many products do you plan to sell? 10s, 100s, or 1000s?
Physical products, digital, or both?
What payment methods do you need? (Card, PayPal, crypto, cash on delivery?)
Do you handle shipping yourself or use a fulfillment service?
Do you need multiple currencies or languages?
Do you have product photos ready, or need photography guidance?
Is there a loyalty/rewards program planned?

design_hints.colors: neutral base with strong accent for CTAs (buy buttons)
design_hints.imagery: professional product shots on clean backgrounds

portfolio.label: Portfolio / Agency / Freelancer
portfolio.description: Showcasing work, services, and expertise for agencies, studios, or individual professionals

suggested_pages.name: Home
suggested_pages.purpose: Striking visual intro, key projects, value proposition

suggested_pages.name: Work/Portfolio
suggested_pages.purpose: Project gallery with filters by type/industry

suggested_pages.name: Case Study (template)
suggested_pages.purpose: Detailed project breakdown: problem, process, result

suggested_pages.name: Services
suggested_pages.purpose: What you offer, how you work, pricing approach

key_questions: What type of work do you showcase? (design, development, photography, etc.)
How many projects should be featured? All or curated best?
Do you want detailed case studies or just visual galleries?
Do you work solo or have a team to showcase?
What's your process for new clients? (Do you need a project inquiry form?)
Do you have a specific visual style or brand guidelines?
Any awards, publications, or notable clients to highlight?

design_hints.mood: creative, polished, distinctive — your website IS your portfolio
design_hints.colors: should reflect your brand personality, often minimal/bold
design_hints.typography: distinctive, carefully chosen — this shows your taste
design_hints.key_element: the work speaks louder than words — hero visuals matter
design_hints.imagery: your actual work, not stock photos

saas.label: SaaS / Web Application
saas.description: Software-as-a-service products with user accounts, dashboards, and subscription billing

suggested_pages.name: Landing Page
suggested_pages.purpose: Value proposition, features, social proof, pricing CTA

suggested_pages.name: Login/Signup
suggested_pages.purpose: Clean auth flow with social login options

key_questions: What core problem does your product solve? In one sentence.
Who is the primary user? (Developer, marketer, manager, consumer?)
What does the main dashboard look like? What data does it show?
What pricing model? (Free tier, trial, monthly, annual, usage-based?)
Do users work individually or in teams?
What integrations are essential at launch?
Is there an existing MVP or starting from scratch?

design_hints.colors: clean primary color + neutral dashboard palette
design_hints.typography: system fonts or highly readable sans-serif
design_hints.key_element: the landing page conversion funnel is critical
design_hints.imagery: product screenshots, UI mockups, not generic stock

restaurant.label: Restaurant / Cafe / Food Business
restaurant.description: Restaurants, cafes, bakeries, catering services, and food delivery businesses

suggested_pages.name: Home
suggested_pages.purpose: Atmosphere photos, featured dishes, reservation CTA

suggested_pages.name: Menu
suggested_pages.purpose: Full menu with categories, prices, dietary info

suggested_pages.name: Contact/Location
suggested_pages.purpose: Address, map, hours, phone, parking info

key_questions: What type of cuisine do you serve?
Do you have a digital menu (PDF, photos) or need one created?
Do you take reservations? If so, how — phone, app, website form?
Do you offer delivery or takeout? Through which services?
What's the atmosphere — casual, fine dining, fast casual?
Do you have professional food photography?
Do you host private events or catering?

design_hints.mood: warm, appetizing, inviting — should make people hungry
design_hints.colors: warm tones (deep reds, ambers, creams), dark backgrounds make food pop
design_hints.typography: elegant serif for headings, clean sans for body
design_hints.key_element: food photography is EVERYTHING — poor photos will kill the site
design_hints.imagery: professional food photography, interior shots, team

blog_media.label: Blog / Media / Content Platform
blog_media.description: Content-focused websites including blogs, news sites, magazines, and educational platforms

suggested_pages.name: Home/Feed
suggested_pages.purpose: Latest content, featured posts, category navigation

suggested_pages.name: Article/Post
suggested_pages.purpose: Individual content page with rich formatting

suggested_pages.name: Categories/Topics
suggested_pages.purpose: Browse by topic, tag, or section

suggested_pages.name: Author Profile
suggested_pages.purpose: Bio, articles by author, social links

key_questions: What topics will you cover? Is there a specific niche?
How many authors/contributors will publish content?
How often will new content be published?
Do you plan to monetize? (Ads, subscriptions, sponsored content?)
Do you need comments or community features?
Is there existing content to migrate?
Do you need a newsletter/email digest?

design_hints.colors: high contrast for readability, subtle accent colors
design_hints.typography: readability is paramount — serif or clean sans, proper line height
design_hints.imagery: featured images for articles, clean whitespace

corporate.label: Corporate / Business Website
corporate.description: Company presence websites for established businesses, B2B companies, and organizations

suggested_pages.name: Home
suggested_pages.purpose: Company overview, key services, trust signals, CTA

suggested_pages.name: Case Studies
suggested_pages.purpose: Success stories with metrics and results

suggested_pages.name: Team/Leadership
suggested_pages.purpose: Key people with bios and photos

key_questions: What does your company do? What industry are you in?
Who is your target client/customer? (B2B, B2C, government?)
How many office locations do you have?
Do you have existing brand guidelines (logos, colors, fonts)?
What's the primary goal of the website — lead generation, information, recruitment?
Do you need multiple languages for international presence?
Are there compliance or regulatory requirements for your industry?

design_hints.colors: navy, dark grays, white — with corporate accent color
design_hints.key_element: credibility signals — client logos, numbers, certifications
design_hints.imagery: professional photography of team, offices, not just stock

classification_rules.instructions: Classify the user's first message into one of the niche types above. If unclear, ask one clarifying question. If the business spans multiple niches, pick the PRIMARY one and note secondary aspects.
classification_rules.fallback: If no niche matches well, use 'corporate' as the default template and ask clarifying questions to narrow down.
multi_niche_examples: A bakery that sells online → primary: restaurant, secondary: ecommerce
A design agency with a blog → primary: portfolio, secondary: blog_media
A SaaS with an e-commerce marketplace → primary: saas, secondary: ecommerce
